snippet: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.
abstract: Comments by two Republican Senate candidates concerning pregnancies that result from rape are said to have derailed party's hopes of gaining seats in the Senate; shortfall highlights gender gap Republican Party has with female voters as the controversial remarks on rape and abortion drowned out other messages.
lead_paragraph: Going into the election, Republican candidates knew they faced obstacles with minorities and women, but candidates’ comments on rape were not among them.

headline.seo: Women’s Issues Were a Problem for G.O.P.
headline.main: Senate Races Expose Extent of Republicans’ Gender Gap
headline.print_headline: Senate Races Expose Extent Of Republicans’ Gender Gap
